intro: Zanthoxylum kallunkiae, commonly known as the Kallunkia prickly ash, is a deciduous shrub native to the southeastern United States. It belongs to the Rutaceae family and is characterized by its compound leaves and yellowish-orange flowers. The plant produces small, red berries that are edible for some wildlife but considered toxic to humans. Zanthoxylum kallunkiae is typically found in moist, acidic soils in forested areas. Its botanical features make it an important component of its native ecosystem.
